intro: Pedicularis paxiana, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are often red or orange in color. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
